drupalNodeEvent.title: China Studies Book Club - Charles Sanft, "Literate Community in Early Imperial China: The Northwestern Frontier in Han Times"

field_speakers.processed: Moderator: Professor Patricia Ebrey, and China Studies Book Club steering committee

field_organizers.processed: China Studies Program, Jackson School of International Studies, University of Washington

field_description.processed: Third Meeting: Charles Sanft, "Literate Community in Early Imperial China: The Northwestern Frontier in Han Times" (May 1, 2019). 276 pages (167 excluding notes). Every year lots of great books about China get published, books that deserve to be widely read and discussed. Book reviews are helpful, but take months or even years to come out. To make it easier for China scholars to discuss with each other some of the recent English-language books they are reading, the University of Washington China Studies Program has started a virtual China Studies Book Club. We think it will be fun to have conversations about books we find exciting, provocative, or moving and invite China scholars elsewhere to join us.
